title: DAY 13 ORDERFLOW, HTF, LIQUIDITY
description: Understanding displacement, FVG, HTF liquidity, and orderflow shifts.
content:
In this lesson, you'll learn:

• What displacement indicates in trading
• Fair Value Gap formation and mechanics
• HTF liquidity as a major draw
• Orderflow shift signals
• Combining HTF and LTF analysis
• Execution precision through alignment

quiz.question: Displacement indicates:
quiz.explanation: Displacement is strong impulsive movement indicating institutional buying/selling.

quiz.question: Fair Value Gap forms due to:
quiz.explanation: FVG occurs when there's an inefficient gap in price that traders later return to fill.

quiz.question: HTF liquidity acts as:
quiz.explanation: Higher timeframe liquidity is a major magnet that price is drawn toward.

quiz.question: Orderflow shift signals:
quiz.explanation: Shift in orderflow indicates changing momentum direction.

quiz.question: Alignment between HTF and LTF improves:
quiz.explanation: When HTF and LTF align, entries become more precise and probability increases.
